intro: Geissorhiza bonae-spei, commonly known as the Cape goldbos, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb that produces tuberous roots, which help it survive dry periods. Its unique morphology and vibrant blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
